Material used.Material Name: Patient-derived fibroblasts and normal control fibroblasts
Material used.Description: The study used fibroblasts derived from the patient with PINK1 mutation and age-matched healthy controls.

Readout description.Result Description: Mitochondrial respiratory function was significantly impaired in patient fibroblasts compared to controls, indicating a loss of PINK1 function.

Biological replicates.Description: The number of biological replicates is not explicitly mentioned.

Technical replicates.Description: The number of technical replicates is not explicitly mentioned.

Basic positive control.Description: No explicit mention of positive controls in the methodology.

Basic negative control.Description: No explicit mention of negative controls in the methodology.

Threshold for normal readout.Source: Based on standard mitochondrial function assays, a respiratory control ratio above 1.5 is typically considered normal.
Threshold for normal readout.Description: Assumed based on common thresholds in mitochondrial studies.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Source: Based on standard mitochondrial function assays, a respiratory control ratio below 1.0 may indicate dysfunction.
Threshold for abnormal readout.Description: Assumed based on common thresholds in mitochondrial studies.

Approved assay.Description: Mitochondrial respiratory function analysis is a well-established method for studying Parkinson disease, particularly in the context of PINK1 mutations.

Material used.Material Name: Patient-derived fibroblasts and normal control fibroblasts
Material used.Description: The study measured ROS levels in fibroblasts to assess mitochondrial dysfunction.

Readout description.Result Description: ROS levels were elevated in patient fibroblasts, indicating oxidative stress due to impaired mitochondrial function.

Biological replicates.Description: The number of biological replicates is not explicitly mentioned.

Technical replicates.Description: The number of technical replicates is not explicitly mentioned.

Basic positive control.Description: No explicit mention of positive controls in the methodology.

Basic negative control.Description: No explicit mention of negative controls in the methodology.

Threshold for normal readout.Source: Based on standard ROS measurement assays, levels below 1.0 fluorescence unit are typically considered normal.
Threshold for normal readout.Description: Assumed based on common thresholds in oxidative stress studies.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Source: Based on standard ROS measurement assays, levels above 2.0 fluorescence units may indicate significant oxidative stress.
Threshold for abnormal readout.Description: Assumed based on common thresholds in oxidative stress studies.

Approved assay.Description: ROS measurement is a widely accepted method for assessing mitochondrial dysfunction in the context of Parkinson disease.
